items.item_text: 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135
items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - Call Meeting to Order at the District Board Room, 4750 San Felipe Road, San Jose, CA 95135

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information on Public Comments and Disability Access
items.item_text_raw: 2. Information on Public Comments and Disability Access

A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Management Personnel Actions:

2.  New Hire 
	 
	 
3.  Change to Classification Title
	 
	 
4.  Management Contract Renewal

items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Management personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_details:
A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the following Classified Personnel Actions:
	 
1. Classification Changes
	 
a. Position Established
Establishment of Purchasing Agent (9PURC0218C) in the Purchasing department at the District Office effective 06/27/12.
	 
	 
2. Change of Status
a. Promotion
Promotion to Articulation Specialist (7CNSS0214C) in Counseling and Matriculation at San Jose City College from Assessment Specialist (7CNSS0204C) in Counseling and Matriculation at San Jose City College effective 07/02/12.
	 
	 
3. Separation
a. Retirement 
Employee retirement effective 06/20/12
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Classified Personnel Actions as a submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.
items.item_text: Hourly, Student Work & Volunteer Personnel Actions

items.item_details:
This item was presented to the Board of Trustees on May 22, 2012, and on June 12, 2012.  The Board of Trustees requested that this item be returned for consideration with inclusion of delineated timelines for deliverables.  
	 
Annually District staff will return to the Board of Trustees with a report detailing the performance of CampusWorks and compliance with the covenants within the contract.  
	 
Annually the reaffirmation of the contract will be brought to the Board of Trustees for consideration.
	 
Section 9 of the proposed contract (attached) allows for the District or CampusWorks to terminate the agreement in the event of a default.  
	 
Section 12 of the proposed contract notes that for the convenience of the District, CampusWorks is agreeing to smooth the payments to the equivalent of 1.5 FTES, but will be providing services which at times will run in excess of 1.5 FTES as deemed necessary to meet critical requirements of the District.  Should the agreement be terminated, the District will need to make CampusWorks whole for these front-loaded services. 
	 
Section 20 of the proposed contract provides that 10% of the contract cost will be set aside and released quarterly upon mutual agreement of the satisfactory completion of project milestones to be developed by District staff in collaboration with CampusWorks at the start of the engagement.
	 
Section 20 prescribes the deliverables and delineated timelines associated with each deliverable per the scope of service.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees award a contract not to exceed $517,452 annually to CampusWorks for strategic technology infrastructure services for a period of three years, subject to determination of satisfactory performance annually by the Board of Trustees commencing July 1, 2012.
